data.title: Feature: Increase units in queue by N
data.body:
In some modern strategy games, you can flood a queue by holding down shift + right click. This will add 5 units to the queue instead of 1. This would be a nice feature for maintaining the production line in-game.

What do you think?

data.title: Control Buttons State Machine
data.body:
Hello all its been a while,

Control buttons will refers to the UI button shortcuts: Power, Sell etc.

I noticed on the openRA mod when a building is in one state, such as powered down, you cannot automatically sell the building without defaulting to the idle state. It would be nice to be able to jump between states.

Luke

data.title: Unpleasent RA Button Sound
Decouple world resolution from window size (arbitrary world zoom).
data.body:
Ability to change full screen display resolution (horizontal x vertical px, e.g. 1024x768 px) in game without manually modifying game files should be a standard. Improves the gameplay experience.

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/4206784-decouple-world-resolution-from-window-size-arbitrary-world-zoom?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).

data.title: Harvesters should automatically find resources when built at factories
data.body: As Ore Truck realizes to seek for ore/diamonds when building up an Ore Refinery, there is no such behaviour when building Ore Truck from War Factory. Instead, an ore truck built separetely just stands still without any activity. This is quite annoying in a hectic game where everything else takes your attention but you forget to order the truck to collect ore/diamonds. Expected behaviour for the ore truck is to start collect ore immediately from the nearest field.

data.title: Trees/Shrubbery should burn when using a flame thrower
data.body:
Expected behaviour for trees is to burn when using flame-based weapons. As far as I've tested, nothing happens currently.
- [x] Tiberian Dawn #11180
- [x] Red Alert #11377
- [ ] Tiberian Sun ~~#11405~~ #11484

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/4206756-trees-shrubbery-should-burn-when-using-a-flame-thrower?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).

data.title: Ability to repair bridges for engineers
data.body: As we know, some players destroy bridges to prevent or supressing enemy attacks from happening. Because this makes ground-attacks impossible in some maps and additionally, AI gets confused (the game slows down dramatically), I would suggest an optional ability for engineers to repair bridges in order to prevent such issues happening. The feature should be optional and available on game options menu. The bridge repair should need time or many engineers to be accomplished.

data.title: AI improvements
data.body:
1: AI doesn't realize to build troops when it should

AI doesn't use its full resources when earning a lot of money. Expected behaviour is to build more infantry, tanks, navy and stuff, but instead, AI decides to build more Ore Silos to store money. This gives no challenge to a human player and makes the gameplay very boring overall. The forementioned event happens especially when playing with low tech levels and in maps with lots of ore.

2: AI should capture buildings

Does AI capture oil derricks? Or does it try to take enemy/your buildings? As far as I've seen, there is no such feature yet. Would be great improvement because it adds game dynamics and interaction between players.

3: AI descriptions

Red Alert AI descriptions are quite understandable. However, I have no idea about C&C TD AI behaviours. How does Watson, or Cabal act in the game field? How do they differ from each other? These unclear and mythic AI titles should be described clearly to a player to improve gaming experience to the end-user.

4: Adjustable AI difficulty

As far as I can remember, there were such feature in the original Red Alert. AI difficulty should be adjustable so players could improve their gaming experience. Scale could be something like...

Very Easy - Easy - Normal - Hard - Very Hard - Insane/Brutal

<bountysource-plugin>

---

Want to back this issue? **[Place a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/4206742-ai-improvements?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Notify a player of gameplay events when all audio is muted
data.body:
For example: When an enemy attacks your base, you get a EVA warning "Our base is under attack". Additionally, and optionally, this information could be offered with a basic text string somewhere on the screen (bottom left?), so if audio is muted for some reason the player still gets information that his/her base is under attack. Same thing with super weapons, airstrikes etc.

As a player, I'm forced to mute my computer audio in some situations (school, public spaces etc.). If I still would like to play OpenRA muted, I don't currently get information if my base is under attack or what is happening around the map. It's not very nice to see your base is half-destroyed just because you were not allowed to use audio in gameplay.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/4206715-notify-a-player-of-gameplay-events-when-all-audio-is-muted?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).

data.title: Added WithDeathAnimation
data.body:
Deprecated RenderInfantry's SpawnsCorpse logic, renamed CrushableInfantry to Crushable (it can now be used to make other actors crushable too, afterall).

Closes #6375.

This can be used to replace DeadBuildingState, too, once #6389 is fixed.

For corpses rather than death animations, read the comments on #4163 about using LeavesHusk for that.

data.title: Fix resourcemap reading and rendering?
data.body:
While inspecting the map format, i noticed that the gems/ore values arent read correctly at all.

Problems found:
- OpenRA ignores the resource density value completely and uses its own algorithm to re-write those densities.
- There is 3 usable levels of gems densities, but it seems to use only 2 of those levels in the game.

It would be good if we could add new option in the map.yaml such as "FixedResources" which means that it would actually read the resourcemap and use those densities defined in it.

But the problem is that there is no publicly released editors currently to actually write and read those values correctly. However, i am making an editor currently, and it would be very nice if we could edit resourcemaps more precisely. I can already save maps resources/tiles in my editor.

The current map editor that comes with OpenRA actually also adds incorrect values into the gems densities: 0-3 randomly, when it should be 0-2.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/4194427-fix-resourcemap-reading-and-rendering?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).

data.body: #4716 implementation of generic observer-stats UI for all mods. Includes a basic UI Editor to adjust information shown per mod per dropdown item. Includes shortcuts for dropdown menu in game settings.

data.title: Help Requested: INotifyActorMovement
data.body:
I need help with the Lua tie-in and testing. I've haven't had much time to spend on this over the past three weeks, and rather than let it lie stagnant, I figured asking for help.

Closes  #6204. (Or meant to)

Pinging @obrakmann as he knows a bit about this.

(Sidenote: I've attempted to use this same code for shroud and crushing, but once you have 300+ listeners + movers the lag becomes visible, so I've restricted this to region checking for now.)

data.title: First frame of most animations is omitted
data.body:
I'm aware this could be considered a clone of other issues, but those other issues just describe specific symptoms caused by this underlying issue.

I've tried to find the exact problem, and I _think_ there's something wrong with PlayThen in Animations. 1-frame animations and the first frame of any longer animation need insanely high tick values just to sometimes show up, while the 2nd frame of any 2+ frames animation is pretty much always displayed.

If the problem is that something is ticking too fast for the first frame to be visible and hard to fix properly, we should at least artificially delay the start of an animation until that problematic point has passed.

In any case, fixing this would close #3706, #4025, and probably #5884.

Additionally, this is a blocker for replacing DeadBuildingState with a normal death animation, unless we want to use the same awfully ugly, hacky work-around as for the D2k muzzle flashes (just look at the muzzle `Frames:`, you'll see what I mean). I'd prefer to see this fixed and get rid of the D2k muzzle hacks instead.

data.title: Provides a bridge to global Lua functions for actor traits.
data.body: I use this for my cell trigger logic, but it can be used to add other actor traits that call or execute Lua. Maybe even add superpowers that use Lua, which would make creating custom mods easier by reducing or removing the need for more C# code.
